agency_desc: Domestic Violence, Sexual Violence and Human Trafficking services. Provides emergency shelter, crisis intervention, secure housing options and supportive services to victims of domestic and sexual violence, stalking and human trafficking as well as prevention programming for youth and in-service training for gateway professionals.
service_description: Provides victim assistance and crisis response to both male and female victims of domestic violence, human trafficking, or sexual assault. Services include court accompaniment, assistance filing a protective order, advocacy, and case management. A 24-hour hotline is available to answer questions about domestic violence or sexual assault, assist victims in preparing safety plans, and provide information and referrals to area resources.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, human trafficking, and stalking

agency_desc: A faith-based organization providing charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry, thrift store, and financial assistance.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in. Pantry is located in a separate building from the office, but on the same property.
site_schedule: Jan-Oct: Monthly 4th Thurs 9am-noon and 1pm-3pm -- Nov and Dec: Monthly 3rd Thurs 9am-noon and 1pm-3pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging, providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, and Pike County.
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunches and fellowship for area seniors. Diabetic menu available. Reservations required 24 hours in advance. Small donation requested.
site_details: Call the senior center at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Persons age 60 and older or persons with disabilities and their spouses or caregivers

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging, providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, and Pike County.
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunches and fellowship for area seniors. Diabetic menu available. Reservations required 24 hours in advance. Small donation requested.
site_details: Call the senior center at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Persons age 60 and older or persons with disabilities and their spouses or caregivers

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Martin County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Martin County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 2nd and 4th Tues 5:30pm
Office: 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 2nd and 4th Tues 5:30pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Martin County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Martin County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Martin County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Martin County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Martin County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance abuse issues and their families. Intensive outpatient services are available.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment)

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Martin County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Martin County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_schedule: Vary; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
Vary; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
Vary; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
Vary; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 10am-6pm; Tues and Fri 10am-5pm; Sat 9am-1pm
Mon and Thurs 10am-6pm; Tues and Fri 10am-5pm; Sat 9am-1pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in the city of Loogootee or Perry or Rutherford townships of Martin County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, and Fri noon-5pm; Thurs 2pm-8pm; Sat 9am-1pm
Mon, Tues, and Fri noon-5pm; Thurs 2pm-8pm; Sat 9am-1pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in the town of Shoals in Martin County

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry, including financial assistance.
service_description: Provides up to $50 of financial assistance with electric, gas, or water utilities for persons in need living in Martin County. No deposits or reconnect fees paid.
site_details: Call for an appointment.
site_eligibility: Received assistance once per year

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Martin County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides immunizations for youth age 2 months through 18 years old.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 2 months through 18 years old -- Without health insurance -OR- Insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- Insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status.

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Martin County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Martin County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Martin County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Martin County

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Martin County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys, or individuals representing themselves. -- For juror information, contact the Clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500.
site_details: Call for information or walk in for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Martin County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Martin County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Martin County

agency_desc: A government entity that provides governance and municipal services for the city of Loogootee.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Loogootee in Martin County.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; services the city of Loogootee

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Martin County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Martin County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Martin County)

agency_desc: A government agency offering a recycling center.
service_description: Maintains a drop-off site for collecting recyclables including:  Aluminum, tin, and steel beverage and food cans -- Newspapers and magazines -- Clothing, shoes, belts, etc. -- Small household textiles
site_details: Bring recyclable to the drop-off location -- Remove all items from trash bags before placing in bin
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips.
service_description: Offers activities for older adults in Martin County, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Age 60 and older

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or email for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area 15), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Crawford, Lawrence, Orange, and Washington County. Also serves as the areas Economic Development Corporation for Crawford, Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Lawrence, Martin, Orange, Pike and Washington County.
service_description: Provides child development services to pregnant mothers, and families with infants and young children, birth to age three
site_details: Call for enrollment information.
site_eligibility: Living in Martin County -- Pregnant women and mothers with children up to 30 months -- Household income at or below 100% Federal Poverty Level
